availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Allen Higgins (Fayette County, KY planter)

body.p: Residence: Lexington, Fayette County, Kentucky. A very wealthy, Kentucky-born planter. Son of Joel Higgins and Ann Louise Gibson. Married Betty Chinn Webb. Father of Sue Webb (Higgins) Cochran, Joel Higgins, Ann Louise (Higgins) Smith, Mary Ford (Higgins) Rodes, and Alline (Higgins) Headley Rogers.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, City of Lexington, 4th Ward, p. 108.

Find A Grave, Entry for John Allen Higgins (1831-1880), Find A Grave Memorial # 51275346, Lexington Cemetery, Lexington, Fayette County, Kentucky, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=51275346&ref=acom (accessed 4 Aug 2017).
